abstract: French Foreign Minister Laurent Fabius introduces idea of new international group which would include Arab world members to spur Israeli-Palestinian peace talks; idea would be alternative to all-but-defunct Middle East quartet comprised of American, Russian, European Union and UN envoys and earlier proposal calling for UN Security Council involvement.
lead_paragraph: Foreign Minister Laurent Fabius of France described his idea as an alternative to the Middle East quartet to spur Israeli-Palestinian negotiations.

headline.main: French Minister Suggests Group to Push Middle East Talks
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; France: New Idea to Spur Mideast Talks

snippet: Foreign Minister Laurent Fabius of France described his idea as an alternative to the Middle East quartet to spur Israeli-Palestinian negotiations.
